Male.description: Gilded Flickers of southern Arizona have yellow under the wings and tail while Northern Flickers in the western U.S. have red under the wings and tail. Gilded Flickers also have more brown on the crown and nape than Northern Flickers which have more gray on the crown and nape.

Female.description: Female Gilded Flickers have more extensive brown on the crown and nape that female Northern Flickers. They have yellow under the wings and tail while Northern Flickers in the western U.S. have red under the wings and tail.
The back of Gila Woodpeckers is barred black and white whereas the back of Northern Flickers is barred black and brown.
Red-bellied Woodpeckers have a black-and-white barred back and red nape whereas Northern Flickers have a black-and-brown barred back and a gray nape.
